edu.biu.scapi.primitives.prf

Class LubyRackoffPrpFromPrfVarying

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.biu.scapi.primitives.prf.PrpFromPrfVarying
      • edu.biu.scapi.primitives.prf.LubyRackoffPrpFromPrfVarying
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    PrfVaryingIOLength, PrpVaryingIOLength, PseudorandomFunction, PseudorandomPermutation

    public final class LubyRackoffPrpFromPrfVarying
extends PrpFromPrfVarying
    The class LubyRackoffPrpFromPrfVarying is one implementation that has a varying input and output length. LubyRackoffPrpFromPrfVarying is a pseudorandom permutation with varying input/output lengths, based on any PRF with a variable input/output length (as long as input length = output length). We take the interpretation that there is essentially a different random permutation for every input/output length.
    Author:
    Cryptography and Computer Security Research Group Department of Computer Science Bar-Ilan University (Meital Levy)

    • Method Detail

      • computeBlock

        public void computeBlock(byte[] inBytes,
                int inOff,
                int inLen,
                byte[] outBytes,
                int outOff)
                  throws javax.crypto.IllegalBlockSizeException
        Computes the LubyRackoff permutation. the algorithm pseudocode is: Input : x = inBytes should be of even length ----------------- Let |x|=2L (i.e., the length of the input is 2L) Let L0 be the first |x|/2 bits of x Let R0 be the second |x|/2 bits of x For i = 1 to 4 SET Li = Ri-1 compute Ri = Li-1 ^ PRF_VARY_INOUT(k,(Ri-1,i),L) [key=k, data=(Ri-1,i), outlen = L] return (L4,R4)
        Parameters:
        inBytes - input bytes to compute
        inOff - input offset in the inBytes array
        inLen - the length of the input array and the output array. Since this is a prp, the input and output lengths should be equal.
        outBytes - output bytes. The resulted bytes of compute
        outOff - output offset in the outBytes array to put the result from
        Throws:
        javax.crypto.IllegalBlockSizeException

      • invertBlock

        public void invertBlock(byte[] inBytes,
               int inOff,
               byte[] outBytes,
               int outOff,
               int len)
                 throws javax.crypto.IllegalBlockSizeException
        Inverts LubyRackoff permutation using the given key.

        Since LubyRackoff permutation can also have varying input and output length (although the input and the output should be the same length), the common parameter len of the input and the output is needed. LubyRackoff has a feistel structure and thus invert is possible even though the underlying PRF is not invertible. The pseudocode for inverting such a structure is the following FOR i = 4 to 1 SET Ri-1 = Li COMPUTE Li-1 = Ri XOR PRF_VARY_INOUT(k,(Ri-1 (or Li),i),L) [key=k, data=(Ri-1,i), outlen = L] OUTPUT (L0,R0)

        Parameters:
        inBytes - input bytes to invert.
        inOff - input offset in the inBytes array
        outBytes - output bytes. The resulted bytes of invert
        outOff - output offset in the outBytes array to put the result from
        len - the length of the input and the output
        Throws:
        javax.crypto.IllegalBlockSizeException

      • getAlgorithmName

        public java.lang.String getAlgorithmName()
        Returns:
        LubyRackoff algorithm name

      • getBlockSize

        public int getBlockSize()
                 throws NoMaxException
        This object has varying input/output lengths, so this function shouldn't be called.
        Returns:
        the input block size in bytes
        Throws:
        NoMaxException
